thread.title: SS-GB now accused of being too LOUD after viewers blasted Sam Riley for 'mumbling' in BBC Nazi drama
thread.title_full: SS-GB now accused of being too LOUD after viewers blasted Sam Riley for 'mumbling' in BBC Nazi drama

author: Hayley Minn
title: SS-GB now accused of being too LOUD after viewers blasted Sam Riley for 'mumbling' in BBC Nazi drama
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Last week, SS-GB viewers were incensed at the BBC drama for the constant “mumbling”. 
And things haven’t got much better for the TV show’s second episode, with viewers now complaining it’s too LOUD! 
SS-GB, which stars James Cosmo and Kate Bosworth, shows what London could’ve looked like if the Nazis won World War Two. 
Viewers thought they were going to have to get extremely close to their TV screens in order to hear Sam Riley’s whispering. Read More SS-GB has now been accused of being too LOUD! (Photo: BBC) Sam Riley was previously accused of ruining the show with his "mumbling" (Photo: BBC) Kate Bosworth stars in the Nazi drama (Photo: BBC) 
But they were shocked when, at the beginning of the second episode, there was instead sudden shouting. 
One tweeted: “Help now they are shouting!” 
Another agreed: “The sound was absolutely fine last week, now it’s comically loud #ssgb.” 
A third shared: “My god… quickly turning tv down to avoid waking the entire street!!!” 
Others were left wincing at the ear-piercingly loud jazz band playing, with one saying: “Wow that band is hurting my ears”. 
The noise complaints come after telly veteran Stephanie Cole said Sam Riley mumbled so much in SS-GB it sounded like he’d caught a cold. 
The Corrie and Open All Hours star, 75, was one of many viewers unimpressed by the sound. Read More And so does James Cosmo (Photo: BBC) SS-GB just can't get the audio volumes right! (Photo: BBC) 
She said: “If we all alienate the audience we should all f**king well go hone. Why that young man is ruining his voice I do not know. 
“It looks stupid. It looks as if he has got a raging cold. I got so incensed. Someone should have said, ‘We chose you because you have a funny personality. You don’t have to do a funny voice’. 
“I assume the actor has chosen this voice or he got a terrible bug at the time of filming.” 
*SS-GB continues on BBC1 on Sunday at 9pm Like us on Facebook
